subject: Communication
title: Listening in Crisis Situations
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Listening in Crisis Situations.

hook.text: A hostage negotiator's most powerful tool isn't a weapon. It's the ability to listen under extreme pressure.

buildup.text: Crisis listening requires calm presence, emotional regulation, and the ability to hear what's beneath the surface.

discovery.text: The FBI's Behavioral Change Stairway: active listening, empathy, rapport, influence, behavioral change.

twist.text: In crisis, the urge to act fast is overwhelming. But rushing past listening almost always escalates the situation.

climax.text: Crisis listening works in everyday emergencies too: a panicking colleague, a grieving friend, a scared child.

punchline.text: In a crisis, the fastest way forward is to slow down and listen.
